meanings.def: the surface of a room that you walk on
examples: a wooden/concrete/tiled floor
His glass fell to the floor and broke.
on the floor The body was lying on the kitchen floor.
ceramic floor tiles
The furniture and floor coverings date from the 1920s.
The alterations should give us extra floor space.
The study was stacked from floor to ceiling with books.
She was sitting on the floor watching TV.
I found her lying on the ground.
The rocket crashed a few seconds after it left the ground.
It was good to be back on dry land again.
They fought both at sea and on land.
You could feel the earth shake as the truck came closer.
Do you mind sitting on the floor?
I can't sleep on the bare floor!
His footsteps echoed on the wooden floor.
She was sitting on the floor watching TV.
The bathroom floor was flooded with water.
There were wooden panels from floor to ceiling.

meanings.def: the bottom surface of a vehicle
examples: The floor of the car was covered in cigarette ends.

meanings.def: all the rooms that are on the same level of a building
examples: Their apartment occupies the top floor of the building.
on the… floor Her office is on the second floor.
a cafe on the mezzanine floor
The upper floors of the building will contain function rooms.
the Irish guy who lives two floors above
There is a lift to all floors.
on… floors Their house is on three floors (= it has three floors).
a five-storey house
The office building is five storeys high.
His office is on the fifth floor.

meanings.def: the ground at the bottom of the sea, a forest, etc.
examples: the ocean/sea/forest floor
A layer of fine mud spread over the floor of the cave.

meanings.def: the part of a building where discussions or debates are held, especially in a parliament; the people who attend a discussion or debate
examples: Opposition politicians registered their protest on the floor of the House.
We will now take any questions from the floor.

meanings.def: an area in a building that is used for a particular activity
examples: on the floor of the Stock Exchange (= where trading takes place)

meanings.def: the lowest level allowed for wages or prices
examples: Prices have gone through the floor (= fallen to a very low level).

meanings.def: to become involved in a plan, project, etc. at the beginning
to get/be given/have the right to speak during a discussion or debate
to speak during a discussion or debate, especially for a long time so that nobody else is able to say anything
examples: She held the floor for over an hour.

meanings.def: to start dancing on a dance floor
examples: Couples took the floor for the last dance of the evening.

meanings.def: to defeat somebody completely in an argument or a competition

idioms.idiom: be/get in on the ground floor
idioms.def: to become involved in a plan, project, etc. at the beginning
to get/be given/have the right to speak during a discussion or debate
to speak during a discussion or debate, especially for a long time so that nobody else is able to say anything
examples: She held the floor for over an hour.

idioms.def: to start dancing on a dance floor
examples: Couples took the floor for the last dance of the evening.

idioms.def: to defeat somebody completely in an argument or a competition

meanings.def: to surprise or confuse somebody so that they are not sure what to say or do
examples: His reply completely floored me.

meanings.def: to make somebody fall down by hitting them, especially in a sport
examples: be floored by somebody/something He was floored by the first punch.

meanings.def: to provide a building or room with a floor
examples: be floored in/with something All of the rooms are floored in solid pine.

meanings.def: to press the accelerator pedal of a car hard
